answer: Basic rule - you can never go wrong with a PV system. But indeed, it is important to us to build well-dimensioned systems, hence our recommendations in advertising and in the FAQs. Principle: the size of the PV system should match the consumption. If you are considering acquiring a heat pump or an electric car in the medium term, have sufficient space on the roof, and have the capital available, the next larger system is a forward-looking solution. Keep in mind, a PV system has a lifespan of 20 years and more. Extensions are always possible afterwards.

answer: In general, there is hardly a more sensible installation than a photovoltaic (PV) system. Why? Because on one hand, it is crucial for the urgently needed climate change that we all make an effort, and on the other hand, because solar energy is now the cheapest form of energy. There is no cheaper energy supply than a sensibly sized PV system on your own roof. Depending on electricity prices, this can pay for itself in a few years - on average currently after 5-7 years; with the significantly higher electricity prices of last year, which could potentially return in some form this coming winter, even much faster. summary: In fact, the law stipulates that when intervening in an existing electrical house system - as is the case with a PV installation - the house installation must be brought up to the current state of technology. Otherwise, the network operator will not ...
answer: In fact, the law stipulates that when intervening in an existing electrical house system - as is the case with a PV installation - the house installation must be brought up to the current state of technology. Otherwise, the network operator will not release the PV system for operation. This is not a direct part of the zholar PV system, but a modification that is needed - regardless of who the PV system comes from. The zholar installation partner can carry out such modifications, but will certainly make a cost estimate before starting work and obtain your approval. Otherwise, you can also ask your house electrician to check the electrical distribution board before the PV installation and upgrade it if necessary.
title: Unforeseen Costs: Renovations in the Electrical Distribution for PV Installation: Costs and Approval Required

answer: The sensor is installed directly in the electrical distribution box by the zholar installation partner and connected to the existing customer-side WiFi network. title: Monitoring - How Does the Energy Monitoring Sensor Work?

summary: The event-based energy monitoring sensor is easy to install as it does not require cables or batteries and is magnetically powered. Unlike time-based sensors, this one sends values based on events, leading to precise measurements with a max deviation ...
answer: The event-based energy monitoring sensor is easy to install as it does not require cables or batteries and is magnetically powered. Unlike time-based sensors, this one sends values based on events, leading to precise measurements with a max deviation of 5%. Additionally, our solution is cost-effective and user-friendly.
title: Monitoring - What is Special About the Energy Monitoring Sensor?

summary: The three-phase energy monitoring sensor can be easily installed in your fuse box without major interruptions to the power supply. The current transformer is placed around the phase cable and the voltage sensors are magnetically attached to the ...
answer: The three-phase energy monitoring sensor can be easily installed in your fuse box without major interruptions to the power supply. The current transformer is placed around the phase cable and the voltage sensors are magnetically attached to the appropriate connections of the circuit breaker. Alternatively, hard wiring is also possible. The inconspicuous sensor fits into most fuse boxes and is installed and activated for you by a zholar partner.
title: Monitoring - How is the Energy Monitoring Sensor Installed?

answer: The Energy Monitoring Sensor operates on an event-based system, meaning it sends an event every time the RMS value of the current changes by more than 200 mA. The Energy Monitoring Sensor also sends time-based information to the BE-Cloud every minute.

answer: The live monitoring of power consumption works through the Energy Monitoring Sensor installed in the electrical distribution box. The sensor continuously measures the current power consumption in real time, distinguishing between different consumption levels such as standby, normal, and intensive. By continuously monitoring power consumption, you can track your energy use in real time to identify inefficient devices or behaviors and achieve targeted energy savings. The live monitoring data is captured by the Energy Monitoring Sensor and transferred to the BE Cloud platform. Within the BE Cloud platform, the data is analyzed using algorithms to provide a comprehensive overview of current energy consumption.
title: Monitoring - How Does Live Electricity Consumption Monitoring Work?

answer: The BE.SpareFlo app allows you to better understand your electricity consumption on a daily and monthly basis by displaying and visually explaining the energy flows occurring in your household in near real-time. BE.SpareFlo helps you to understand your energy consumption even better. You can also find out if you are using too many devices at the same time, if you should have left a technical device switched on when leaving your apartment or house, or if you should reduce the consumption of permanently switched-on devices (standby). Additionally, you can identify your consumption peaks and estimate the best time for doing laundry, washing dishes, etc.

Depending on the types of devices you have at home, some devices that have a very similar electric current curve are summarized in the report. For example, an electric oven and an electric stove are listed in the "Kitchen" category. We are constantly expanding the list of devices we can monitor, so more devices will be available soon.

summary: In the BE.SpareFlo app, you can store your current electricity price. Based on this price, the costs for each device or device category are determined. You always have the option to update the electricity price in the menu. Please note that the cost ...
title: Monitoring - How are the costs calculated for individual devices/device groups?
answer: In the BE.SpareFlo app, you can store your current electricity price. Based on this price, the costs for each device or device category are determined. You always have the option to update the electricity price in the menu. Please note that the cost calculation is based on the assumption that the electricity is 100% sourced from the grid. If you produce your own electricity, for example through your photovoltaic system, this is currently not offset in the app.

summary: Yes, the app and the underlying algorithms are continuously improved and optimized. In the future, expansions and updates are planned to integrate additional APIs, such as electric vehicle charging solutions. This will allow information and features ...
answer: Yes, the app and the underlying algorithms are continuously improved and optimized. In the future, expansions and updates are planned to integrate additional APIs, such as electric vehicle charging solutions. This will allow information and features from various manufacturers to be bundled into a central all-in-one application, eliminating the need for additional manufacturer-specific applications. The goal is to create a manufacturer-independent, central application that allows a collective display and control of all energy flows. Future functions and updates for the app include the following roadmap: Energy Insights: Direct insight into energy consumption at the device level to better understand energy use and identify potential cost savings. Reports: Weekly and monthly energy reports in-app and via newsletter (available from summer 2023). Energy saving tips: General energy saving tips
title: Monitoring - Are there any future features or updates planned for the app?

summary: Without the purchase of a zholar inverter (Huawei SUN2000-3KTL-M1, SUN2000-5KTL-M1, SUN2000-8KTL-M1 or technically comparable) or the Energy Monitoring Sensor (Three-phase sensor), the use of the application is not possible. The zholar inverter and ...
answer: Without the purchase of a zholar inverter (Huawei SUN2000-3KTL-M1, SUN2000-5KTL-M1, SUN2000-8KTL-M1 or technically comparable) or the Energy Monitoring Sensor (Three-phase sensor), the use of the application is not possible. The zholar inverter and the Energy Monitoring Sensor are essential for the collection and analysis (using algorithms) of the electricity flows occurring in the household and thus for the main functions of the application. Therefore, the purchase of the hardware components (storage not mandatory) is necessary to be able to use the application and its functions.
title: Monitoring - Can I Use the App Without the Energy Monitoring Sensor, a PV System, or a Battery Storage?

Currently, only values from the zholar inverter (Huawei SUN2000-3KTL-M1, SUN2000-5KTL-M1, SUN2000-8KTL-M1) can be displayed in the app. In addition, the system must have been commissioned by a zholar installation partner and assigned to the zholar ...
title: Can I also display the values of my existing PV system, which I did not purchase from zholar, in the BE.SpareFlo app?
answer: Currently, only values from the zholar inverter (Huawei SUN2000-3KTL-M1, SUN2000-5KTL-M1, SUN2000-8KTL-M1) can be displayed in the app. In addition, the system must have been commissioned by a zholar installation partner and assigned to the zholar account in the inverter manufacturer's online portal (e.g., Huawei FusionSolar) in order for the inverter data to be displayed in the BE.SpareFlo app.

summary: The production data from your PV system or your battery storage is not displayed in real time due to technical limitations of the manufacturer (in this case, Huawei). The measurement or query and display of data in the BE.Spare Flo app occurs at ...
answer: The production data from your PV system or your battery storage is not displayed in real time due to technical limitations of the manufacturer (in this case, Huawei). The measurement or query and display of data in the BE.Spare Flo app occurs at intervals of 5 minutes. This means that it may take a few minutes for changes in production or in relation to your battery storage to become visible in the app. We are continuously working to improve the data update and keep the time delay as minimal as possible.
title: Monitoring - Why aren't my production data from my PV system or battery storage displayed in real time?

summary: The BE.SpareFlo app, and specifically the energy reporting of the app, does not replace your final bill from your electricity supplier. The values displayed in the app are guidelines and may differ from the actual values billed by the energy ...
answer: The BE.SpareFlo app, and specifically the energy reporting of the app, does not replace your final bill from your electricity supplier. The values displayed in the app are guidelines and may differ from the actual values billed by the energy supplier. The app is primarily designed to provide an overview of energy consumption and to help save energy. However, it never replaces the actual billing by the energy supplier.
title: Does the BE.SpareFlo App or the energy reports from the app replace my final billing from my electricity supplier?

summary: This naturally depends on consumption and electricity prices! With SolMate and four connected panels, you save approximately 1200 kWh per year. At 50 cents per kWh (energy price including taxes, levies, and grid charges), that would be a savings of ...
title: Balcony Power Plant - When Will My SolMate Pay Off?
answer: This naturally depends on consumption and electricity prices! With SolMate and four connected panels, you save approximately 1200 kWh per year. At 50 cents per kWh (energy price including taxes, levies, and grid charges), that would be a savings of 600 € per year, or in other words: the payback period in this case is 5-6 years. In addition, SolMate provides an integrated emergency power supply, so the device pays for itself twice over in the event of a longer power outage.

summary: In island mode, power can be drawn from the SolMate via the socket. A maximum of one Class I device (device with metal housing) may be plugged into the socket, but several Class II devices may be connected simultaneously. SolMate can supply devices ...
title: Balcony Power Plant - How Does Island Operation Work?
answer: In island mode, power can be drawn from the SolMate via the socket. A maximum of one Class I device (device with metal housing) may be plugged into the socket, but several Class II devices may be connected simultaneously. SolMate can supply devices up to 1000 watts (2000 watts startup power for 0.5 seconds) in island mode. The SolMate generates a pure sine wave power signal, which means that most consumers can be operated without any problems.

summary: Yes, in principle, this is possible. Please note: If you use SolMate in island mode and still consume the generated electricity every day and empty the storage, then that's fine. However, if you continuously have your storage in island mode with ...
title: Balcony Power Plant - Can I Use the Zholar SolMate Exclusively in Island Operation?
answer: Yes, in principle, this is possible. Please note: If you use SolMate in island mode and still consume the generated electricity every day and empty the storage, then that's fine. However, if you continuously have your storage in island mode with connected solar panels, the battery is permanently charged to the maximum, which can lead to battery degradation.

summary: SolMate physically feeds into only one phase and also only measures this one phase. However, the balancing is done across all three phases. Typically, the consumers are distributed across the three phases. If there is a larger, constant consumer on ...
answer: SolMate physically feeds into only one phase and also only measures this one phase. However, the balancing is done across all three phases. Typically, the consumers are distributed across the three phases. If there is a larger, constant consumer on another phase, the MySolMate app allows for the setting of a constant base consumption that should always be fed in.
title: Balcony Power Plant - Does SolMate Only Supply Devices on One Power Phase?

summary: If you disconnect your SolMate from your household outlet, there will be no more voltage. The built-in inverters have integrated, certified safety precautions that ensure that voltage is only present when a power grid is detected. If no power grid is ...
answer: If you disconnect your SolMate from your household outlet, there will be no more voltage. The built-in inverters have integrated, certified safety precautions that ensure that voltage is only present when a power grid is detected. If no power grid is detected, the voltage at the plug is switched off in less than 200 milliseconds.

summary: The storage unit has a capacity of 1.44 kWh and the energy stays in the storage until you use it, storage losses are minimal. So, if you were to actually not consume any power, the battery would remain fully charged for many days to weeks if the ...
answer: The storage unit has a capacity of 1.44 kWh and the energy stays in the storage until you use it, storage losses are minimal. So, if you were to actually not consume any power, the battery would remain fully charged for many days to weeks if the storage is turned off. If the storage is turned on and no new energy is coming from the sun, your SolMate will remain active for 1-2 weeks and then finally be empty. Basically, the storage is intended as a buffer - during the day (when the sun is shining) it is filled with excess energy and at night this stored electricity is consumed.
title: Balcony Power Plant - How Long Can the Electricity Be Stored?

summary: The Huawei Blackout Box is a special unit that was designed to maintain the power supply of your PV system in case of a power outage. It serves as a backup power supply system and ensures that the power supply to critical consumers - through the PV ...
answer: The Huawei Blackout Box is a special unit that was designed to maintain the power supply of your PV system in case of a power outage. It serves as a backup power supply system and ensures that the power supply to critical consumers - through the PV system or storage - continues to be available even in the event of network failures.
title: Storage - What is a Huawei Blackout Box FRT?

summary: The Blackout Box is connected to your inverter with a power storage unit and stores excess energy that your PV system generates or stores in the battery during normal operation. In the event of a power outage, the Blackout Box can then use this ...
title: Storage - How Does the Huawei Blackout Box Work?
answer: The Blackout Box is connected to your inverter with a power storage unit and stores excess energy that your PV system generates or stores in the battery during normal operation. In the event of a power outage, the Blackout Box can then use this stored energy to maintain the power supply.

summary: The duration for which the Blackout Box can maintain the power supply depends on various factors, including the size of the power storage, the performance of your PV system, and your individual power consumption. A few hours are quite realistic.

answer: The duration for which the Blackout Box can maintain the power supply depends on various factors, including the size of the power storage, the performance of your PV system, and your individual power consumption. A few hours are quite realistic.

summary: The Blackout Box provides protection against power outages and can help maximize the self-consumption of your PV system. It ensures a continuous power supply for your most important consumers, even if the public grid fails. This is implemented ...

It ensures a continuous power supply for your most important consumers, even if the public grid fails. This is implemented through a so-called "PV Point" as a specially designated 230 V outlet.
title: Storage - What is the Blackout Box Needed For?

answer: The PV point can handle up to 3,000W - 3,300W depending on the size of the inverter and the connected battery storage (max. 15.2A).

summary: The installation of the PV system takes about one working day in total (excluding any additional services that may be required). Depending on the approach of the zholar installation partner, the process can also be divided into several stages. First, ...
title: Photovoltaics - How does the installation of the PV system proceed?
answer: The installation of the PV system takes about one working day in total (excluding any additional services that may be required). Depending on the approach of the zholar installation partner, the process can also be divided into several stages. First, during an on-site inspection, the placement of the modules and the cable routes will be discussed with you. This is followed by the roof mounting of the modules, the wiring from the modules to the inverter, and then from the inverter to the meter/fuse box. Once the installation is complete, a technical inspection is carried out, including a test protocol along with instruction and handover of the PV system. The test protocol will be sent to you after the installation has been checked and approved by zholar.

summary: The establishment of a photovoltaic (PV) system is considered a significant modification/expansion of an existing electrical system under Austrian law. As soon as an existing electrical system is altered, for example, by a PV installation, the entire ...
answer: The establishment of a photovoltaic (PV) system is considered a significant modification/expansion of an existing electrical system under Austrian law. As soon as an existing electrical system is altered, for example, by a PV installation, the entire system must comply with the current state of technology to obtain the test protocol. It is possible that your electrical system may require additional services to achieve this necessary current state of technology for a positive test protocol and commissioning of the PV system. Such additional services are not covered by the zholar scope of services. answer: Clean Energy Financing: Making Sustainable Energy Affordable Transitioning to clean energy has never been easier with flexible financing options designed to fit your budget. Whether you’re a homeowner or a business owner, our solutions make clean energy projects achievable and cost-effective. Financing Solutions Accessible Options for Everyone We provide various financing solutions tailored to your needs, including: •   Solar Loans: Competitive rates and flexible terms. •   Power Purchase Agreements (PPAs): Zero upfront costs with predictable payments. •   Lease Options: Affordable monthly payments and performance guarantees. Our experts will guide you through the financing process to ensure you choose the best option for your clean energy transition.  Compare financing options Solar Loans Flexible and Affordable Solar loans provide upfront funding for your project, allowing you to: •   Own your system outright. •   Take advantage of tax credits and rebates. •   Pay over time with competitive rates and flexible terms. Power Purchase Agreements (PPAs) Energy Without Upfront Costs With a PPA, you can enjoy clean energy benefits without the initial investment. Key advantages include: •   Fixed energy payments over the contract term. •   Professional maintenance and system monitoring. •   Zero ownership responsibilities. Lease Options Affordable and Hassle-Free Leasing allows you to access clean energy with low monthly payments. Benefits include: •   Equipment upgrades during the lease term. •   Performance guarantees for peace of mind. •   No need to manage system ownership or maintenance. Why Choose Clean Energy Financing? •   Cost Savings: Lower energy bills and predictable payments. •   Accessibility: Solutions for different budgets and energy goals. •   Sustainability: Enable your transition to renewable energy without financial strain.  Explore financing options  Calculate your savings Clean energy financing makes it easier than ever to take the first step toward a sustainable future. With flexible plans and expert guidance, you can start saving money and reducing your environmental impact today.

summary: Home Energy Storage Guide Learn how battery storage systems can enhance your home's energy independence and provide reliable backup power. How Energy Storage Works Understanding Battery Systems Modern home battery systems provide multiple benefits: • ...
answer: Home Energy Storage Guide Learn how battery storage systems can enhance your home's energy independence and provide reliable backup power. How Energy Storage Works Understanding Battery Systems Modern home battery systems provide multiple benefits: • Store excess solar production for nighttime use • Provide backup power during grid outages • Enable peak-shaving to reduce utility bills • Support grid services for additional income Battery systems can be installed with new solar panels or retrofitted to existing solar installations. Smart controls optimize charging and discharging based on your energy needs and utility rates. Battery Technologies Choosing the Right Solution Modern home energy storage options include: • Lithium-ion batteries: Most common, offering excellent performance and lifespan • Lead-acid batteries: Traditional technology, lower cost but shorter lifespan • Flow batteries: Emerging technology with promising scalability Key factors in selecting a battery system include: • Capacity and power output • Round-trip efficiency • Warranty and expected lifespan • Installation requirements • Cost and available incentives Cost and Savings Investment and Returns Battery storage system costs typically range from $8,000 to $20,000, depending on capacity and features. Cost factors include: • Battery capacity and power rating • Installation complexity • Additional equipment needs • Available incentives and tax credits Return on investment comes from: • Reduced utility bills through peak-shaving • Backup power value • Grid services participation • Solar self-consumption optimization
title: Home Energy Storage Guide

title: Community Solar Guide  Save on Energy Without Installing Panels
answer: Community Solar Guide: Save on Energy Without Installing Panels Community solar programs offer an innovative way to enjoy the benefits of solar energy without needing to install panels on your property. Learn how these programs work and how they can help you save on energy costs while supporting renewable energy in your community. What is Community Solar? Shared Solar Energy for All Community solar allows multiple participants to share the benefits of a single solar array, often located off-site. Subscribers earn credits on their electricity bills based on their share of the power produced, leading to savings and promoting clean energy growth. 👉 Learn more How Does It Work? Simple Steps to Start Saving 1.   Subscribe: Select a local community solar project and sign up for a portion of its energy production. 2.   Energy Generation: The solar farm produces electricity and feeds it into the grid. 3.   Bill Credits: Receive credits on your electricity bill for your share of the solar energy. 4.   Savings: Pay the solar provider at a discounted rate, resulting in net energy savings. 👉 Find local projects Benefits of Community Solar 1.   No Installation Required: Enjoy solar energy without installing panels. 2.   Cost Savings: Save 5-20% on annual electricity costs. 3.   Accessibility: Perfect for renters, condo owners, or those with unsuitable roofs. 4.   Support Local Clean Energy: Contribute to renewable energy growth in your community. 5.   Flexibility: Easy enrollment with no maintenance or long-term commitments. Flexible Subscription Options Tailored to Your Needs Choose a plan that fits your energy needs and budget, offering a flexible and hassle-free way to embrace solar power. Take advantage of community solar to reduce your energy costs, support renewable energy, and make a positive environmental impact—without the need for installation or maintenance.

answer: Heat Pump Guide: Efficient Heating and Cooling for Your Home Heat pumps are an energy-efficient solution for heating and cooling, providing year-round comfort while lowering energy consumption and reducing your carbon footprint. Learn how they work, their benefits, and how to choose the best system for your home. How Do Heat Pumps Work? Efficient Climate Control Heat pumps transfer heat between your home and the outside air, offering heating in the winter and cooling in the summer. Instead of generating heat, they move it, making them a cost-effective and energy-efficient choice for climate control.  Learn more Types of Heat Pumps Choosing the Right System 1.   Air Source Heat Pumps: Extract heat from the air, ideal for moderate climates. 2.   Ground Source (Geothermal) Heat Pumps: Use the earth’s stable temperature for consistent efficiency. 3.   Ductless Mini-Split Heat Pumps: Provide zoned heating and cooling without ductwork—perfect for retrofits or home additions.  Compare heat pump types Benefits of Installing a Heat Pump Why Choose a Heat Pump? 1.   Cost Savings: Reduce energy bills with high-efficiency operation. 2.   Dual Functionality: One system for both heating and cooling. 3.   Low Maintenance: Fewer mechanical components mean reduced maintenance needs. 4.   Safety: No combustion process, eliminating risks associated with gas heating.  Discover more benefits How to Choose the Right Heat Pump Key Factors to Consider 1.   Climate: Select a system suited for temperature extremes in your region. 2.   Home Size and Insulation: Proper sizing is crucial for efficiency and comfort. 3.   Budget: Balance upfront costs with potential energy savings and available incentives. 4.   Professional Consultation: Work with certified installers to find the best fit for your home.  Find local installers A heat pump is a versatile and environmentally friendly option for year-round comfort. By understanding your needs and the available systems, you can make an informed decision and enjoy efficient, cost-effective climate control in your home.
